description: The beloved, but burdened, princess of the floating city of Wyndia. She is a skilled duelist and wind mage, caught between her royal duties and her desire to forge her own path.

lore.background: The princess of the floating city of Wyndia, Nina was born to a life of duty and political machinations. She feels trapped by her royal duties and joins the party seeking the freedom to forge her own path, but her royal status brings both powerful connections and dangerous political enemies.
lore.narrative_hook: Nina is burdened by the political machinations of the Ember Concord and her father's strict expectations. She seeks freedom, but her royal status brings both powerful connections and dangerous political enemies.

starting_moves.name: Royal Edict
starting_moves.description: When you leverage your royal authority to command an NPC with a title or rank, roll `2d6 + Heart`. On a **10+**, they are compelled to obey a reasonable command. On a **7-9**, they obey, but it will cause political complications later, or they demand a significant favor in return.

starting_moves.name: Dance of the Gales
starting_moves.description: When you use your wings to gracefully engage a foe in melee, roll `2d6 + Finesse`. On a **10+**, you deal your harm and choose one: you reposition to any advantageous spot, or you create an opening for an ally (+1 for their next move). On a **7-9**, you deal your harm, but your flamboyant attack leaves you exposed.

starting_moves.name: Gale Shield
starting_moves.description: When an ally is about to take harm, you can shield them with a swirling gust of wind. Roll `2d6 + Finesse`. On a **10+**, the harm is completely negated. On a **7-9**, the harm is halved, but the effort leaves you staggered (take a -1 penalty on your next move).

advanced_moves.name: By Royal Decree
advanced_moves.description: When you use Royal Edict and roll a 12+, the NPC is so impressed by your authority that they carry out your command with haste and offer an additional, unexpected benefit (a resource, a secret, or future aid). However, the political complications on a 7-9 are now more severe.

advanced_moves.name: Voice of the People
advanced_moves.description: You have learned to connect with people not as a princess, but as a peer. You can now use your Royal Edict move on commoners, merchants, or even bandits, relying on your personal charisma instead of your title. When you do, the complications on a 7-9 are personal rather than political (e.g., you create an emotional debt, or they misinterpret your intentions).

advanced_moves.name: Unfettered Flight
advanced_moves.description: When you use Wind-Rider, you can push yourself to fly with the reckless abandon of a wild falcon, not a trained royal. On a 10+, you can choose to arrive in a hidden or unexpected position, allowing your next action to be from cover or surprise. The cost on a 7-9 is that your flamboyant, un-princess-like display will be the talk of the court, causing political fallout for your family later.

advanced_moves.name: Diplomatic Immunity
advanced_moves.description: When you are in a civilized settlement, you can make your identity as the Princess of Wyndia known. When you do, you cannot be imprisoned or harmed by local authorities, but your presence will attract both powerful allies and dangerous enemies.

bond_synergy.name: A Breath of Fresh Air
bond_synergy.description: Rya's untamed nature inspires Nina to act outside the rigid confines of her upbringing. Once per session, Nina can use her **Royal Edict** move on a commoner, bandit, or even a monster, using her force of personality rather than her title. It works as if she had rolled a 10+. When she does, Rya is inspired by her friend's courage and also takes a +1 bonus on her next move.
